name: Thoughts on Pagination
description: During 1998 Netscape released Netscape Communicator code under an open source licence, enabling thousands of developers to participate in improving the software. However, they decided to start from the beginning, which guided the development of the open source browser and soon expanded to a complete application platform.

However, they decided to start from the beginning, which guided the development of the open source browser and soon expanded to a complete application platform.<\/span><span>\u00a0The\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Web_Standards_Project\" title=\"Web Standards Project\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Web_Standards_Project\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">Web Standards Project<\/a><span>\u00a0was formed and promoted browser compliance with\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(HTML)\" title=\"Comparison of layout engines (HTML)\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(HTML)\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">HTML<\/a><span>\u00a0and\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(Cascading_Style_Sheets)\" title=\"Comparison of layout engines (Cascading Style Sheets)\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(Cascading_Style_Sheets)\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">CSS<\/a><span>\u00a0standards by creating\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid1\" title=\"Acid1\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid1\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">Acid1<\/a><span>,\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid2\" title=\"Acid2\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid2\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">Acid2<\/a><span>, and\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid3\" title=\"Acid3\" data-cms-link=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Acid3\" data-cms-link-type=\"external\">Acid3<\/a><span>\u00a0tests. 2000 was a big year for Microsoft. Internet Explorer was released for Mac; this was significant as it was the first browser that fully supported HTML 4.01 and CSS 1, raising the bar in terms of standards compliance. It was also the first browser to fully support the\u00a0<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Portable_Network_Graphics\" title=\"Portable Network Graphics\"
